messages.message: Who’s the best person to contact about the upcoming IBDoc changes? I couldn’t find any issues tagged with the current release, but have heard that we’re moving towards IBDoc instead of IBOCR everywhere. I’d like to understand the implications for the Diff app, since we presently read IBOCRs there. cc: @shaunak @Jessica (from stalking Github). Is there a resource I can read?
it won’t be noticeable, it’ll be an under-the-hood change that should be unnoticeable to you assuming you use the `ParsedIBOCR` object (except you’ll magically start spitting out/consuming IBDOCs).
but shaunak is the best person to talk to in terms of the data format

yeah - we need to test it throughly when this is released. all our pre-built solutions will update to use `parsedIBOCR`, but wonder if we might have client-built scrips (SC and C1 mostly) that will break.

@Jesika Haria this is still under development which is why there is no release plan yet.  What Chetan mentioned is accurate.  The `ParsedIBOCR` library will hide everything so as long as you continue to use that library, everything should work appropriately.

@Kerry definitely.  The plan is to test this out for _at least a month_ before rolling it out to consumers.  I’ve been coordinating with Hari to roll out the changes to SC, but would need your help to roll these changes out to our pre-built solutions.
